study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of hydroquinone esterified with stearic acid in solid lipid nanoparticles (SLNs) as a drug delivery system for melanoma treatment.
results_summary: The SLNs showed potential in influencing anchorage-dependent cell proliferation in COLO-38 human melanoma cells and modulated the expression of apoptotic proteins p53 and p21WAF1/Cip1. Safety tests assessed cytotoxicity and pro-sensitizing potential, while antioxidant and anti-inflammatory activities were also evaluated.
population_specificity: COLO-38 human melanoma cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the ability of titanium dioxide (TiO2) and iron (III) oxide (Fe2O3) to reduce the chronic toxicity of hydroquinone (HQ) and catechol (CAT) in aquatic organisms.
results_summary: Hydroquinone (HQ) exhibited greater toxicity than catechol (CAT) in both Ceriodaphnia dubia and Pimephales promelas, with lower LC50 values. Treatment with Fe2O3 was more effective than TiO2 in reducing the toxic effects of HQ and CAT.
population_specificity: Ceriodaphnia dubia (water fleas) and Pimephales promelas (fathead minnows), less than 24 h-old.
effective_dosage: LC50 for HQ was 0.07 to 0.05 mg.L-1.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) in hydroquinone-induced autophagy and apoptosis in human lymphoblastoid cells (TK6) and the involvement of activating transcription factor 6 (ATF-6).
results_summary: Hydroquinone induced cytotoxicity, ERS, autophagy, and apoptosis in TK6 cells, mediated by reactive oxygen species (ROS). Inhibition of ROS and ERS reduced autophagy and apoptosis. ATF6 knockdown enhanced autophagy and apoptosis, while its activation improved cellular activity, suggesting ATF6 affects these processes via mTOR.
population_specificity: Human lymphoblastoid cells (TK6)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the catalytic role of hydroquinone (HQ) in the electrophoretic deposition (EPD) of hybrid alginate-Au nanoparticle films and its potential applications in sensor development, catalysis, and biological studies.
results_summary: The study found that hydroquinone oxidation, catalyzed by gold nanoparticles, facilitates the EPD of alginate and Au NPs, with smaller nanoparticles (4 nm) showing higher catalytic activity. The resulting hybrid hydrogel films exhibited optical and electrochemical properties suitable for sensor and catalytic applications.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether nitrogen plasma therapy could safely complement topical hydroquinone to improve clinical outcomes in melasma treatment.
results_summary: The study found that hydroquinone significantly reduced melanin and improved clinical scores, with greater improvement when combined with nitrogen plasma therapy. No significant adverse effects or stratum corneum damage were reported.
population_specificity: Women with melasma.
study_duration: Eight treatment sessions, one week apart, with a follow-up one month post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of non-fractional picosecond lasers (PSNYL and PSAL) with 2% hydroquinone (HQ) cream in treating melasma.
results_summary: The study found that 2% HQ cream showed significant improvement in melasma severity (MASI scores) but was less effective than PSNYL and comparable to PSAL. HQ's safety profile was similar to the laser treatments, with transient adverse events.
population_specificity: 60 melasma patients with Fitzpatrick skin types III-IV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effect of hydroquinone cream (HQC) with and without microneedle roller (PMR) pretreatment on UV-induced melasma in mice.
results_summary: Both direct HQC application and PMR pretreatment followed by HQC showed therapeutic effects, with the PMR group exhibiting better results. The study confirmed improvements via skin observation, SOD activity, MDA content, histology, and OCT imaging.
population_specificity: UV-induced melasma mouse model

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of the lncRNA LINC01480 in hydroquinone (HQ)-induced apoptosis and its regulatory mechanism via the PI3K/AKT pathway.
results_summary: HQ increased LINC01480 expression dose-dependently, leading to apoptosis via inhibition of the PI3K/AKT pathway. Silencing LINC01480 reduced HQ-induced apoptosis, while overexpression enhanced it, suggesting LINC01480 as a potential therapeutic target for HQ toxicity.
population_specificity: TK6 cells (a human lymphoblastoid cell line)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hydroquinone (HQ) induces NLRP3 inflammasome-dependent pyroptosis in JHP cells via AhR-mediated pathways and to explore its toxic effects.
results_summary: HQ caused inflammation and pyroptosis in JHP cells by inducing endoplasmic reticulum stress (ERS) and reactive oxygen species (ROS) release. These effects were reversed by antioxidants, ERS inhibitors, and AhR inhibitors, suggesting AhR-mediated toxicity.
population_specificity: JHP cells (a human cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 4% topical hydroquinone (HQ) with 100mg/mL intradermal tranexamic acid (TA) in reducing melasma severity in female patients.
results_summary: Both HQ and TA significantly reduced melasma severity (MASI scores) after three months, with no significant difference between the two treatments. Mild burning pain at the injection site was reported, but no serious adverse effects occurred.
population_specificity: 48 women with melasma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Nrf2 regulates cell cycle progression in TK6 cells upon hydroquinone treatment and the underlying mechanisms involved.
results_summary: The study found that hydroquinone induced cell cycle arrest in TK6 cells, accompanied by activation of the Nrf2 signaling pathway. Nrf2 loss accelerated cell cycle progression and increased ROS production by downregulating SOD and GSH, with regulation occurring via the p16/pRb pathway.
population_specificity: Human lymphoblastoid cell line (TK6 cells)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of topical 1% hexylresorcinol and 2% hydroquinone in reducing facial and hand pigmentation.
results_summary: Both 1% hexylresorcinol and 2% hydroquinone significantly reduced pigmentation at 4 and 12 weeks with no difference between the two treatments. No adverse effects were reported for either intervention.
population_specificity: 32 healthy female participants aged 35-65 with skin types I-IV.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of 2% hydroquinone versus 1.4% silymarin cream for treating melasma in Asian patients.
results_summary: Hydroquinone showed statistically significant improvements in modified MASI scores (17.97% reduction) and patient satisfaction (69.6% good-excellent improvement), though it had more adverse effects than silymarin. Both treatments improved relative lightness index (RL*I), but hydroquinone's efficacy was slightly better.
population_specificity: Asian patients with epidermal or mixed-type melasma (n=23 completed).
effective_dosage: 2% hydroquinone applied to one facial side.

study_goal: To compare the efficacy and safety of hydroquinone (HQ) cream alone versus HQ cream combined with 755-nm picosecond (PS) laser in the treatment of melasma.
results_summary: Both HQ alone and HQ + PS laser significantly improved mMASI scores, with no statistically significant difference between the two treatments. Mild postinflammatory hyperpigmentation occurred in 15% of patients on the laser-treated side, while no adverse effects were reported with HQ monotherapy.
population_specificity: Twenty subjects with mixed-type melasma.
effective_dosage: 2% HQ cream applied to both sides of the face.
study_duration: 4 weeks of HQ application followed by 5 biweekly PS laser treatments (total duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of a combination of autologous PRP and 4% Hydroquinone versus 4% Hydroquinone alone in treating melasma.
results_summary: The combination of autologous PRP and 4% Hydroquinone showed significantly greater improvement (82%) in melasma compared to Hydroquinone alone (69%), as measured by modified MASI, patient satisfaction, and physician assessment scores. Adverse effects were mild and transient.
population_specificity: Thirty patients with melasma.
study_duration: Four months (one microneedling session per month).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy and tolerability of a non-hydroquinone topical serum (LYT2) for treating pregnancy-induced melasma.
results_summary: LYT2 significantly reduced hyperpigmentation scores by Week 4 (-5.8%) and further by Week 12 (-14.6%), improved MASI scores and QoL, and was well tolerated.
population_specificity: 34 non-pregnant women (mean age 42) with mild to severe facial melasma following pregnancy.
effective_dosage: Applied twice daily (specific concentration not provided).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of intralesional tranexamic acid and topical 4% hydroquinone in treating melasma.
results_summary: Topical 4% hydroquinone showed complete improvement in 32.41% of patients, but intralesional tranexamic acid was more effective (44.14% improvement). The difference was statistically significant (p-value = 0.040).
population_specificity: 290 patients with melasma, aged 18-50 years, excluding those with specific conditions like discoid lupus erythematosus, pregnancy, or anemia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the role of glycolysis in hydroquinone (HQ)-promoted malignant progression of TK6 cells and investigate the involvement of SIRT1 in this process.
results_summary: Acute HQ exposure inhibited glycolysis and reduced SIRT1 and glycolytic enzyme expression, while long-term HQ exposure promoted glycolysis, increased SIRT1 and glycolytic enzyme levels, and accelerated malignant progression. SIRT1 knockdown reduced glycolysis and tumor formation in HQ-treated cells.
population_specificity: TK6 cells (a human lymphoblastoid cell line)
study_duration: Acute exposure (48 hours), long-term exposure (10-15 weeks)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify the upstream pathway involved in ROS-mediated TNF-α expression in hydroquinone-treated human acute myeloid leukemia cell lines.
results_summary: Hydroquinone increased SIDT2 expression, which reduced miR-25 and SIRT3 levels, leading to NOX4-mediated ROS production and TNF-α upregulation. Inhibition of NOX4 or SIRT3 overexpression abolished HQ-induced ROS and TNF-α effects.
population_specificity: Human acute myeloid leukemia cell lines (U937 and HL-60).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cysteamine 5% cream versus hydroquinone 4%/ascorbic acid 3% (HC) cream in treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone 4%/ascorbic acid 3% (HC) cream significantly reduced the melanin index more than cysteamine, though both treatments improved melasma severity (mMASI score) and quality of life similarly. The HC group showed a more pronounced reduction in melanin levels after 4 months.
population_specificity: 65 patients with melasma (out of 80 initially enrolled) in a single-blind, randomized, controlled trial.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 35% glycolic acid peel versus Jessner peel as adjuvants to topical triple combination therapy (containing 2% hydroquinone) in treating melasma in females.
results_summary: The study found that both glycolic acid peel and Jessner peel showed similar efficacy when used with topical triple combination therapy, with moderate to good improvement in 84% and 92% of cases, respectively. Hydroquinone-containing therapy was effective but recommended to be avoided in pregnant women due to safety concerns.
population_specificity: Females with melasma attending Skin-VD OPD, Baroda Medical College (60 cases enrolled, 50 completed the study).
effective_dosage: 2% hydroquinone (as part of a triple combination therapy with 0.025% tretinoin and 0.01% fluocinolone acetonide).
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (study period: September 2016 to July 2017).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the toxic profile of free hydroquinone on urinary bladder cells (T24) as a target of therapeutic action.
results_summary: Hydroquinone showed cytotoxic and prooxidative effects on T24 cells at higher concentrations, with proteomic changes indicating oxidative stress and stress-adaptive responses. The toxic effect was enhanced by recovery, but shorter exposure times did not induce reactive oxygen species.
population_specificity: Urinary bladder cells (T24) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the safety and efficacy of hydroquinone for treating hyperpigmentation and discuss alternative treatment options.
results_summary: Hydroquinone is effective for hyperpigmentation but prolonged use is associated with cancer risk and exogenous ochronosis, leading to regulatory changes. Alternative agents like thiamidol, Polypodium leucotomos, and glutathione show promise but require further evaluation.
population_specificity: Individuals aged 40-45 years with hyperpigmentation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of aryl hydrocarbon receptor (AhR) activation by hydroquinone (HQ) in HQ-induced DNA damage and apoptosis in human lymphocytes, and the influence of ROS on this process.
results_summary: HQ caused oxidative stress, DNA damage, and apoptosis in JHP cells, mediated by AhR activation. Pretreatment with an AhR antagonist or antioxidant (NAC) mitigated these toxic effects, suggesting ROS-regulated AhR activation drives HQ toxicity.
population_specificity: Cultured human lymphocytes (JHP cells)
interactions: NAC (antioxidant) and TBHQ (Nrf2 activator) were used to modulate HQ effects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether the hydroquinone derivative CIN-RM could suppress lung cancer stem cells (CSCs) by targeting key regulatory pathways.
results_summary: CIN-RM demonstrated toxicity to lung cancer cells (IC50 ~15 µM), suppressed CSC colony and spheroid formation, and depleted CSC markers and transcription factors by inhibiting Akt/mTOR signaling and promoting c-Myc degradation. Computational analysis confirmed strong binding affinity between CIN-RM and Akt.
population_specificity: Lung cancer stem cells (in vitro study).
study_duration: Effects observed within 24 hours of treatment.

study_goal: The researchers were examining the effectiveness of hydroquinone in treating recalcitrant lesions of Lichen planus pigmentosus-inversus (LPP-inversus).
results_summary: The study found that hydroquinone, in combination with topical clobetasol, was ineffective in treating rapidly developing unilateral LPP-inversus lesions. The lesions remained recalcitrant to therapy.
population_specificity: A woman originally from Nepal with unilateral LPP-inversus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of topical hydroquinone (4%) alone versus microneedling combined with topical tranexamic acid in treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone (4%) showed a statistically significant reduction in melasma severity (54.8% mean decrease in MASI score) after eight weeks, with minimal side effects and slightly higher satisfaction among raters and subjects compared to the alternative treatment.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with melasma, predominantly female.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an electrochemical sensor using Ce-MOF/CNTs nanocomposites for the simultaneous detection of hydroquinone (HQ) and catechol (CC).
results_summary: The post-treated Ce-MOF (TV)/CNTs/GCE sensor exhibited well-defined peaks for HQ and CC oxidation, with linear detection ranges of 10–100 μM for HQ and 5–50 μM for CC. The sensor leveraged the electrical conductivity of CNTs, the two-valence state of Ce, and the high surface area of MOFs for effective detection.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro electrochemical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review data on hydroquinone-associated ochronosis to determine risk factors for patients experiencing this adverse event.
results_summary: Hydroquinone-associated ochronosis was most frequently reported in middle-aged women of African descent, Black races, and Fitzpatrick skin types V-VI, particularly with concentrations above 4% and use longer than 3 months. Patients presented with facial blue-black or gray-blue macules, and histopathology showed solar elastosis and banana-shaped fibers in the dermis.
population_specificity: Middle-aged women (53.2%), of African descent (45.2%), Black races (55.5%), and Fitzpatrick skin types V-VI (52.4%).
study_duration: Median duration of use was 5 years, with some cases reported at 3 months or shorter.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether hydroquinone induces the secretion of proinflammatory cytokines IL-1β and IL-18 in human retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells and its potential role in oxidative stress and DNA damage.
results_summary: Hydroquinone significantly increased IL-18 secretion but not IL-1β, induced NLRP3 inflammasome activation in primed RPE cells, and caused DNA damage (reduced PARP levels). ROS scavenger NAC restored PARP levels but did not affect IL-18 release, while NADPH oxidase inhibitor APDC reduced IL-18 release without altering NLRP3 levels.
population_specificity: Human retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells (ARPE-19 cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of a triple combination cream (including Hydroquinone 4%) with and without oral tranexamic acid in reducing melasma severity.
results_summary: The study found no statistically significant difference in melasma improvement between the group using the triple combination cream alone and the group combining it with oral tranexamic acid. Hydroquinone as part of the triple combination cream showed efficacy in reducing melasma severity, but adding tranexamic acid did not enhance this effect.
population_specificity: 63 melasma patients (predominantly female, mean age ~30-31 years) in a tertiary care hospital in Pakistan.
effective_dosage: Hydroquinone 4% (as part of a triple combination cream applied topically).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether adding hydroquinone (HQ) to PEDOT:PSS could improve electrical conductivity and power conversion efficiency in Si/PEDOT:PSS hybrid solar cells.
results_summary: The study found that HQ significantly improved the electrical conductivity of PEDOT:PSS to 937 S/cm and enhanced the power conversion efficiency of solar cells by 10.6%. HQ also maintained the work function characteristics of PEDOT:PSS by promoting continuous conductive channels.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (HQ was added to PEDOT:PSS solution, but exact concentration not detailed).
study_duration: Not specified (study focused on fabrication process, not longitudinal intervention).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the mechanisms by which hydroquinone (HQ) exacerbates rheumatoid arthritis (RA) symptoms, focusing on its activation of AhR and IL-17 pathways.
results_summary: HQ worsened arthritis symptoms in mice by increasing inflammation, cytokine secretion, and synoviocyte proliferation, effects mediated through AhR and IL-17 pathways. In vitro, HQ upregulated TNFR1, TNFR2, and ROS production, while AhR antagonism mitigated these effects.
population_specificity: Rats, human fibroblast-like synoviocytes (RAHFLS), and wild-type, AhR-/-, and IL-17R-/- C57BL/6 mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of topical 4% hydroquinone versus 0.2% Thiamidol for treating facial melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone showed a 33% reduction in mMASI scores and 74% improvement in GAIS, comparable to Thiamidol. No significant differences in efficacy or tolerability were found between the two treatments, though hydroquinone had no reported adverse effects in this study.
population_specificity: Fifty women with facial melasma, predominantly phototypes III-IV, mean age 43 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining oral tranexamic acid with topical hydroquinone 4% for treating mixed melasma.
results_summary: Combining hydroquinone 4% with oral tranexamic acid resulted in the greatest improvement in melasma (77.47% mMASI score improvement) compared to other treatments. Side effects included itching, irritation, and post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation.
population_specificity: Patients with mixed melasma (60 total, divided into three groups of 20 each).
study_duration: 3 months of oral tranexamic acid, with follow-up for 9 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and tolerability of hydroquinone 4% versus a liposomal form of azelaic acid 20% as adjuvants to oral tranexamic acid in treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone 4% showed significant improvement in melasma but was less tolerable and less effective than the liposomal azelaic acid 20%. It also had a less positive impact on patients' quality of life compared to the alternative treatment.
population_specificity: Fifty females suffering from melasma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand the molecular mechanism by which panicein A hydroquinone (PAH) and its analogues inhibit PTCH1 efflux activity, potentially enhancing chemotherapy efficacy.
results_summary: The study identified the Neck pocket as the preferential binding site for PAH analogues on PTCH1 and found that compounds with an open cylindric-like shape in solution were more likely to be effective PTCH1 binders, enhancing doxorubicin and vemurafenib toxicity in vitro and in vivo.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro) and presumably animal models (in vivo) based on context.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of 2% hydroquinone against 1.8% liposomal tranexamic acid and microneedling with 5% tranexamic acid solution for treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone showed comparable efficacy to the other treatments, with 30.0% of patients achieving "more than 50% improvement" and a significant reduction in melanin index. However, it did not significantly reduce erythema index, unlike the tranexamic acid treatments.
population_specificity: 60 melasma patients (Chinese population)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of 4% hydroquinone (HQ) combined with Er:YAG laser therapy versus intradermal tranexamic acid (TA) plus 4% HQ for treating refractory melasma.
results_summary: Both treatment regimens (HQ + laser and HQ + TA) significantly improved melasma severity and patient satisfaction, with comparable efficacy. However, recurrence rates were higher with HQ + laser (34%) than with HQ + TA (12%).
population_specificity: 31 female patients with refractory melasma (27 completed the study).
study_duration: Duration not explicitly stated, but follow-up was three months post-treatment.

study_goal: The researchers sought to determine whether a non-HQ topical formulation (SKNB19) could provide similar or improved efficacy to hydroquinone 4% (HQ4%) with a reduced adverse reaction profile.
results_summary: SKNB19 showed statistically significant improvement in hyperpigmentation appearance (28.5% better in patient self-assessment, 27% better in independent reviewer assessment) compared to HQ4%, with lower irritation and better tolerability. One patient dropped out due to severe intolerance to HQ4%, while no adverse effects were reported for SKNB19.
population_specificity: Eighteen adult subjects with facial hyperpigmentation.
effective_dosage: HQ4% applied nightly; SKNB19 applied twice daily (morning and night).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate hydroquinone's potential as an anti-PRV agent by assessing its ability to inhibit viral adsorption, internalization, and replication in vitro and in vivo.
results_summary: Hydroquinone demonstrated high anti-PRV activity by inhibiting viral adsorption and internalization, activating the PI3K-AKT pathway, reducing viral loads in mouse tissues, and lowering mortality rates post-PRV infection.
population_specificity: In vitro (N2a cells) and in vivo (ICR mice infected with PRV mutant strain ZJ01).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of combining 585-nm QSNYL laser with 4% hydroquinone (HQ) cream versus 4% HQ cream alone for treating telangiectatic melasma in patients with Fitzpatrick skin phototypes III-V.
results_summary: The combination treatment showed more significant improvement in melasma severity (mMASI) than HQ cream alone at weeks 2, 4, and 8, but 19% of patients developed postinflammatory hyperpigmentation (PIH) on the laser-treated side, particularly in darker skin types (IV-V). HQ cream alone was effective but less so than the combination.
population_specificity: Thai female patients with telangiectatic melasma and Fitzpatrick skin phototypes III-V.
effective_dosage: 4% HQ cream applied daily at night.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of hydroquinone cream versus cysteamine cream in treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone cream showed a 32% reduction in mMASI, outperforming cysteamine (21.3%), though the difference was not statistically significant. Hydroquinone was better tolerated than cysteamine, with mild and reversible side effects.
population_specificity: 20 participants with melasma in Victoria, Australia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of topical 4% hydroquinone versus 5% cysteamine in treating facial melasma in women.
results_summary: Hydroquinone showed superior efficacy in reducing mMASI and MELASQoL scores compared to cysteamine, with a 53% reduction in mMASI at 120 days. Both treatments were safe and well-tolerated, with no severe adverse effects reported.
population_specificity: 40 women with facial melasma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of hydroquinone (HQ), an oxidant in cigarette smoke, on RPE cell injury and whether risuteganib (RSG) could mitigate these effects.
results_summary: HQ induced cell death, mitochondrial dysfunction, oxidative stress, and cytoskeletal disruption in RPE cells. RSG cotreatment significantly protected against these adverse effects, improving mitochondrial function and reducing oxidative damage.
population_specificity: Cultured human retinal pigment epithelial (RPE) cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of cysteamine 5% cream versus hydroquinone-based treatments for postinflammatory hyperpigmentation (PIH).
results_summary: Hydroquinone or triple combination cream (containing hydroquinone) was unsuccessful in treating PIH in the case study, while cysteamine 5% cream showed significant improvement over 4 months. The abstract notes hydroquinone can have significant short- and long-term side effects.
population_specificity: A 20-year-old woman with Fitzpatrick skin type V and chronic severe PIH.
effective_dosage: Not specified for hydroquinone (triple combination cream mentioned but no dosage details).
study_duration: Not specified for hydroquinone (unsuccessful treatment duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a bio-coloration technique using laccase catalysis of hydroquinone to dye chitosan-templated cotton fabrics.
results_summary: The study demonstrated successful polymerization of hydroquinone with chitosan under laccase catalysis, evidenced by UV-vis spectrophotometry, FTIR spectroscopy, SEM, and XPS, indicating effective dyeing of cotton fibers.
population_specificity: Cotton fabrics and other cellulosic materials.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic efficacy and safety of hydroquinone (HQ) 4% cream versus tranexamic acid (TA) 5% cream in treating melasma.
results_summary: HQ 4% cream significantly improved melasma lesions after 12 weeks, with comparable results to TA 5% in Hemi MASI and MELASQOL scores, but TA showed greater reduction in melanin area percentage. No significant difference in adverse effects was noted between the two treatments.
population_specificity: 100 female patients with melasma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the cytotoxicity of hydroquinone 5-O-amino ester derivatives of renieramycin M against metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer cell lines.
results_summary: The hydroquinone derivatives showed cytotoxic activity but were less potent than the 22-O-amino ester derivatives. The most effective compound, 5a, demonstrated significantly higher cytotoxicity than renieramycin M and doxorubicin against H292 cells.
population_specificity: Metastatic non-small-cell lung cancer cell lines (H292 and H460).
effective_dosage: IC50 values provided (e.g., 3.56 nM for 5a), but exact dosage and frequency not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of microneedling plus tranexamic acid versus 4% hydroquinone in treating melasma.
results_summary: The study found that 4% hydroquinone significantly reduced the mean MASI score from baseline, with no statistical difference in efficacy compared to microneedling plus tranexamic acid. Patient satisfaction was higher than physician satisfaction in both groups.
population_specificity: 60 women with melasma (30 in each treatment group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of hydroquinone on skin structure and its potential harm, as well as the protective role of aloe vera.
results_summary: Hydroquinone caused structural disruptions in the stratum corneum and epidermis, reduced skin thickness, and increased p65 expression, indicating harmful effects. Aloe vera mitigated some of these disruptions.
population_specificity: Adult female Wistar rats (average weight 120 g)
effective_dosage: 2% and 4% hydroquinone, applied to tail skin

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hydroquinone 4% combined with microneedling and a modified Kligman's formula in treating refractory centrofacial melasma.
results_summary: The study found significant improvement in melasma, with an 82.5% decrease in MASI score and a 60% improvement in quality of life (MELASQoL-BP). No relapse was observed at the 5-month follow-up.
population_specificity: A 42-year-old woman with phototype V and refractory centrofacial melasma.
effective_dosage: Hydroquinone 4% (sterile serum drug delivery initially, then as part of modified Kligman's formula daily).
study_duration: 30 days of active intervention, with follow-up at 5 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effects of S-allyl L-cysteine (SAC) on hydroquinone-induced oxidative stress-related apoptosis in retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) cells.
results_summary: Hydroquinone reduced cell viability and increased apoptosis in ARPE19 cells, while SAC pretreatment mitigated these effects by suppressing ROS generation and downregulating antioxidant gene expression. SAC demonstrated protective effects against hydroquinone-induced oxidative damage in RPE cells.
population_specificity: Human ARPE19 cells (retinal pigment epithelium cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of oral tranexamic acid combined with hydroquinone cream compared to hydroquinone cream alone in treating moderate-to-severe melasma.
results_summary: The combination of oral tranexamic acid and hydroquinone cream resulted in a 55% reduction in mMASI after 3 months, significantly outperforming hydroquinone alone (10.9% reduction). The benefits persisted post-treatment, with a 42% reduction in Group A compared to 4.7% in Group B.
population_specificity: Subjects with moderate-to-severe melasma.
study_duration: 3 months of intervention, followed by 3 months of follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of combined Er: YAG laser and HQ 4% treatment versus HQ 4% alone in reducing melasma severity.
results_summary: The combined treatment (laser + HQ 4%) showed a statistically significant reduction in melasma severity (measured by MASI) compared to HQ 4% alone. The study concluded that the combination therapy is superior for melasma treatment.
population_specificity: 29 patients with melasma, treated on both sides of the face.
study_duration: Three laser sessions at 4-week intervals (total duration not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the regulatory loop between the long noncoding RNA FAS-AS1 and DNMT3b in Hydroquinone-induced malignant transformed cells and benzene-exposed workers to understand its role in benzene-related carcinogenesis.
results_summary: The study found that Hydroquinone exposure downregulated FAS-AS1 expression, which was negatively correlated with benzene exposure time. Restoring FAS-AS1 promoted apoptosis and inhibited tumorigenicity, while DNMT3b and histone acetylation were involved in FAS-AS1 regulation.
population_specificity: HQ-TK6 cells and benzene-exposed workers (17 paired workers exposed within 1.5 years, 103 paired workers with longer exposure).
study_duration: Not specified for HQ-TK6 cells; benzene exposure in workers ranged from within 1.5 years to longer durations.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of topical hydroquinone, tretinoin, and betamethasone on reducing hyperpigmentation in rat skin grafts.
results_summary: The study found that the treatment group showed significantly lower hyperpigmentation scores (MSS) at day 45 and reduced melanocytes and melanin pigment intensity (histologically) compared to controls, though the day 75 MSS difference was not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Long-Evans rats with split-thickness skin grafts.
effective_dosage: Not specified (combination cream of hydroquinone, tretinoin, and betamethasone).
study_duration: Treatment applied from day 15 to day 75 (60 days total).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether compound C, an AMPK inhibitor, could block the AMPK-TET2-FOXP3 axis in AML and HQ-selected malignant cells, potentially improving AML therapy.
results_summary: Compound C suppressed AMPK/TET2-mediated FOXP3 expression and induced autophagy-dependent apoptosis in both parental and HQ-selected malignant U937 cells, suggesting the AMPK/TET2/FOXP3 axis as a promising therapeutic target for AML.
population_specificity: Human AML U937 cells and HQ-selected malignant U937 cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of tert-butyl hydroquinone (tBHQ) pre-treatment on oxidative stress-related toxicity caused by SeMet and tBOOH in zebrafish embryos.
results_summary: Pre-treatment with tBHQ (100 µg/L) influenced the expression of glutathione-disulfide reductase (gsr) in zebrafish embryos exposed to tBOOH, but the abstract does not detail specific effects of tBHQ alone on safety or efficacy outcomes.
population_specificity: Zebrafish (Danio rerio) embryos

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a ratiometric fluorometric probe using silicon-doped carbon quantum dots (Si-CQDs) for selective detection of hydroquinone (HQ).
results_summary: The study found that HQ oxidation in the presence of Si-CQDs quenches blue fluorescence and generates intense green fluorescence, enabling HQ detection with a 0.077 μM limit and an analytical range of 1-40 μM.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a triple combination cream containing hydroquinone 4% for treating melasma in Middle Eastern patients.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in melasma severity (mMASI), skin lightness (L value), and pigmentation (E value) after 8 weeks of treatment. Mild adverse effects like pruritus, scaling, and erythema were reported but were generally tolerable.
population_specificity: 22 female volunteers (mean age 39.20±4.16 years) with melasma, primarily Middle Eastern.
effective_dosage: Hydroquinone 4% + tretinoin 0.05% + fluocinolone acetonide 0.01%, applied nightly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer activity of the hydroquinone derivative EA-100C red on glioblastoma (GBM) cell growth, focusing on its effects on apoptosis, oxidative stress, and autophagy.
results_summary: EA-100C red demonstrated a higher anti-proliferative effect on LN229 compared to U87MG cells, inducing apoptosis and autophagy while up-regulating pro-apoptotic genes. The compound triggered ER stress-mediated apoptosis through CHOP and Beclin1 up-regulation and activation of key pathways like caspases 3, 9, JNK, and NF-kappaB.
population_specificity: Glioblastoma (GBM) cell lines (LN229 and U87MG).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize the enzymatic glycosylation of hydroquinone (HQ) using whole-cell biotransformation to achieve high-yield production of α-arbutin.
results_summary: The study demonstrated that whole-cell transformation using Amy-1 achieved high conversion rates (>99%) and final concentrations (up to 540 mM) of α-arbutin, with industrial-scale production yielding 375-398 mM at ~95% conversion. Excess glucose from sucrose hydrolysis was identified as an inhibitor, requiring balanced reaction conditions.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro and industrial-scale biotransformation study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (process optimization focused on molar ratios and reaction conditions).
study_duration: 13-18 hours (laboratory scale); industrial scale duration not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy and safety of hydroquinone 4% versus methimazole 5% in treating melasma.
results_summary: Hydroquinone 4% showed a more significant reduction in MASI scores compared to methimazole but had a higher relapse rate after discontinuation. Both treatments had similar side effects, and patient/physician satisfaction scores favored hydroquinone.
population_specificity: Fifty patients with melasma, with forty completing the study.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of oral tomato extract as an adjuvant therapy for melasma when used alongside topical hydroquinone-4%-cream.
results_summary: The study found that combining hydroquinone-4%-cream with tomato extract supplementation significantly improved melasma severity (measured by MASI scores) and increased serum SOD levels compared to the placebo group.
population_specificity: 62 subjects with melasma at Diponegoro National Hospital, Indonesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hydroxyapatite (HA) augmentation improves lag screw fixation strength in osteoporotic intertrochanteric femoral fractures.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in bone mineral density (f-BMD) or maximum lag screw insertion torque (TMax) between the HA and non-HA groups. However, the HA group showed a significantly higher TMax/f-BMD ratio, suggesting improved fixation strength relative to bone density.
population_specificity: Extracted human femoral heads from patients who underwent bipolar hip arthroplasty.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the properties, applications, and challenges of Hydroxyapatite (HAp) composites in bone tissue engineering.
results_summary: The study found that HAp composites enhance mechanical support, cell growth, tissue regeneration, and new bone formation, though they require optimization for better degradation and functionality.
population_specificity: Not specified (general review of HAp composites in bone tissue engineering).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel composite scaffold combining hydroxyapatite (HA)-wollastonite (WOL) gyroid lattices with chitosan-gelatin cryogels to enhance mechanical integrity and bioactivity for bone tissue engineering.
results_summary: The HA-WOL composite scaffold demonstrated superior compressive modulus, strength, and enhanced osteoblast-like cell viability and proliferation, indicating improved mechanical stability and bioactivity compared to cryogel-only constructs. The scaffold supported tissue regeneration potential across bone defects.
population_specificity: Osteoblast-like (MG63) cell cultures (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the corrosion resistance and mechanical properties of an organic composite/hydroxyapatite (HA) coating on magnesium alloys for medical implant applications.
results_summary: The PEI/Si/HA coating demonstrated significantly lower corrosion current density (10^-5.6 A/cm²) compared to HA alone and the Mg substrate, with minimal H2 generation and pH fluctuations after 13 days of immersion. The spray method provided superior corrosion resistance compared to hydrothermal treatment.
population_specificity: Magnesium alloy substrates (in vitro study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety and complications of calcium hydroxyapatite (CaHA) injections in the periorbital region, particularly focusing on adverse effects and management strategies.
results_summary: The study reported a case of persistent lower eyelid irregularities and edema following CaHA injection, requiring surgical intervention due to fibrosis and granulomatous inflammation. It highlights the risks of CaHA in delicate areas and the need for careful patient selection and technique.
population_specificity: A 40-year-old patient receiving CaHA injections for periorbital rejuvenation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a Schiff base-chitosan-vanillin/hydroxyapatite (CHI-VAN/HA) composite for removing brilliant green dye from aquatic systems.
results_summary: The CHI-VAN/HA composite demonstrated a high adsorption capacity (295.74 mg/g) for brilliant green dye, with the process being spontaneous, endothermic, and facilitated by multiple interactions (electrostatic, π-π, n-π, H-bonding, and Lewis acid-base). The composite's physicochemical properties and cost-effectiveness ($215/kg) support its potential for wastewater treatment.
population_specificity: Aquatic systems (in vitro study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential effects of calcium hydroxyapatite (CaHA) injections on improving the biomechanical properties of facial burn scars compared to untreated skin.
results_summary: Preliminary findings suggest CaHA injections improved skin extensibility, elasticity, viscoelasticity, hydration, erythema, and pigmentation in facial burn scars, supported by visual assessments and validated scar scales.
population_specificity: 13 patients with mature facial burn scars (2-5 years old) covering over 90% of the face, including hypertrophic, atrophic, and/or keloid scars.
study_duration: 6 months (measurements taken at 2, 4, and 6 months post-treatment)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the radiolabeling of hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (HANP) smaller than 50nm with technetium-99m and assess their in vivo distribution in rabbits for potential use in bone imaging and bone tumor treatment.
results_summary: The study found that 99mTc-HANP exhibited high radiochemical purity (96%) and excellent in vitro stability for 4 hours, with stable in vivo performance over 6 hours. Quantitative analysis showed significant bone tissue accumulation by the second hour, suggesting potential for bone imaging and cancer applications.
population_specificity: Rabbits

study_goal: The researchers aimed to design a targeted small-molecule delivery system using hydroxyapatite to address oxidative damage and improve drug delivery in osteoarthritis treatment.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite-based nanoparticles (AHQ) combined with microspheres (PPC-AHQ) exhibited excellent antioxidant properties and cell adhesion, suggesting potential for effective osteoarthritis therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Hydroxyapatite (HAP) could be effectively formed and recovered from low-strength wastewater using a denitrifying biological phosphorus removal (DPR) system.
results_summary: The study found that HAP formation was facilitated by denitrifying polyphosphate-accumulating organisms (DPAOs), achieving 99.3% phosphorus removal efficiency. HAP cores contributed significantly to phosphorus removal and influenced microbial community distribution in granular sludge.
population_specificity: Low-strength wastewater treatment systems

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of hydroxyapatite (HA) in composite microspheres (KGM/SA/HA and CKGM/SA/HA) for bone tissue engineering, focusing on drug release properties, biocompatibility, and stability.
results_summary: The study found that HA-containing microspheres exhibited pH-responsive drug release, with higher release rates at lower pH levels. Both microspheres demonstrated good biocompatibility, thermal stability, and bacteriostatic properties.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel tri-layered citrate-based hydroxyapatite (Ci-HA) composite scaffold for periodontal bone defect treatment, focusing on bone regeneration, barrier effects, and wound healing.
results_summary: The Ci-HA scaffold promoted osteoblastic differentiation in stem cells, upregulated angiogenesis-related gene expression, and demonstrated enhanced bone formation, osseointegration, and wound healing comparable to commercial products (Bio-Oss and Bio-Gide).
population_specificity: Rat periodontal intrabony three-wall defect model and human cell lines (bone mesenchymal stem cells, periodontal ligament stem cells, gingival fibroblasts).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the synergistic therapeutic potential of Prussian Blue Erbium-Doped Hydroxyapatite (PB-Er-HAp) nanoparticles for photothermal and photodynamic therapy in cancer treatment.
results_summary: PB-Er-HAp nanoparticles demonstrated significant photothermal and photodynamic effects under 808 nm laser irradiation, effectively inducing cancer cell death in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells through heat generation and reactive oxygen species production. The study highlights their potential as a versatile platform for combined cancer therapy and imaging.
population_specificity: MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells (in vitro)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a hydroxyapatite-chitosan biomaterial, with or without stem cell-conditioned medium, in reducing inflammation and promoting tissue regeneration in a rat dermatitis model.
results_summary: The hydroxyapatite-chitosan biomaterial, especially when combined with conditioned medium, reduced skin thickening, inflammatory influx, and mast cell activity, while lowering levels of pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-α, IL-1β, IL-6, VEGF) and promoting tissue regeneration.
population_specificity: Rats with induced dermatitis.
effective_dosage: Applied once as a dressing (specific amount not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers compared the camouflage effect and color stability of nano-hydroxyapatite (nHAP) remineralization against resin infiltration and microabrasion for treating white spot lesions (WSLs).
results_summary: Nano-hydroxyapatite showed the least masking effect for WSLs and lower color stability compared to resin infiltration and microabrasion, though all treatments increased resistance to discoloration compared to the control. None of the methods fully restored the original enamel color.
population_specificity: Extracted human teeth (50 sound teeth, 40 with induced WSLs).
study_duration: Treatment effects were assessed after immersion in coffee for 7 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a pH-responsive, magnetic Fe3O4-hydroxyapatite (Fe/HAP) and polysuccinimide (PSI) nanoplatform for targeted delivery of fluorouracil (5-FU) in liver cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that the magnetic 5-FU@FeDC formulations exhibited uniform nanoparticle characteristics, prolonged liver tissue retention, and enhanced inhibition of Huh-7 liver cancer cell proliferation compared to non-magnetic formulations. The nanoparticles showed pH-dependent drug release, with higher release rates at increased pH levels.
population_specificity: Huh-7 liver cancer cells and in vivo mouse models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a synthetic bone graft (b.Bone) combined with bone marrow aspirate concentrate in treating distal femoral non-union.
results_summary: The synthetic bone graft successfully facilitated bone healing and restored function in a patient with a 2.2 cm bone defect, as confirmed radiologically. The approach demonstrated potential as an alternative to traditional grafts for complex non-unions.
population_specificity: A young male patient with an open fracture of the distal femur and subsequent atrophic non-union.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effectiveness of hydroxyapatite-coated sulfonated PEEK (HA PEEK) in enhancing shear bond strength with flowable resin composite compared to other surface treatments.
results_summary: HA PEEK demonstrated the highest shear bond strength among all tested groups, with cohesive and mixed failure modes indicating strong bonding. The study concluded that combining sulfonation with hydroxyapatite coating significantly improves PEEK's bonding performance.
population_specificity: PEEK disks (in vitro study, no human or animal subjects).
study_duration: Not applicable (evaluation after thermocycling for 5000 cycles).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of Nano-hydroxyapatite (HA) coating with other surface pretreatment techniques on surface roughness and shear bond strength of Y-TZP zirconia.
results_summary: Nano-HA coating (Group-IV) showed the highest surface roughness and shear bond strength, outperforming other techniques like Tribochemical silica coating (TBC) and Femtosecond laser (FS). The study concluded that Nano-HA coating is a viable alternative to traditional methods without compromising zirconia's properties.
population_specificity: Lab-based study using Y-TZP zirconia discs (no human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (surface treatment application, not oral dosage).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and evaluate hydroxyapatite zirconium conjugated with cetuximab (HApZr-CTX) as a nanocarrier for targeted delivery in X-ray dynamic therapy and radioimmunotherapy for lung cancer.
results_summary: HApZr-CTX demonstrated increased cellular ROS generation and reduced viability in A549 lung cancer cells when irradiated. It successfully loaded and delivered 177Lu, accumulating primarily in the lungs of healthy mice.
population_specificity: A549 lung cancer cells and healthy mice.
study_duration: 0.5 h incubation for internalization; one-hour post-injection observation in mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the incorporation of selenocystine (SeCys) with hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (HASeCys) to enhance its stability and solubility for potential anticancer applications.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite nanoparticles functionalized with selenium (HASeCys) showed promising anticancer activity, particularly when combined with both crystalline gray and amorphous red selenium. The highest elemental selenium yield was achieved using thermal decomplexing co-precipitation.
population_specificity: Cancer cell lines (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop collagen/hydroxyapatite scaffolds for bone tissue engineering and evaluate their structural, morphological, and antimicrobial properties.
results_summary: The scaffolds exhibited porous structures with interconnected pores and well-distributed hydroxyapatite, demonstrating strong antibacterial activity against E. coli and S. aureus without additional antibacterial agents.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study on bacterial strains).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the osteogenesis potential of PMMA-hydroxyapatite (HA) combined with SHED for alveolar bone defect therapy using a bioinformatic approach.
results_summary: HA interacted with proteins involved in extracellular matrix organization and osteogenesis pathways, showing potential for bone defect therapy. PMMA-HA was neither hepatotoxic, carcinogenic, immunotoxic, nor cytotoxic, but PMMA had lower binding affinity to SHED proteins than the control ligand.
population_specificity: In silico study (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the osteogenic potential of 3D-printed PLA scaffolds coated with nano-hydroxyapatite (nHA) and naringin (NAR) for dental regeneration using human pulp stem cells.
results_summary: The study found that PLA/nHA/NAR scaffolds showed the highest cellular attachment, calcium deposition, and osteogenic marker expression (ALP and DSPP), significantly outperforming PLA/MTA scaffolds. These results suggest nHA/NAR coatings enhance osteogenic differentiation and mineralized tissue formation.
population_specificity: Human dental pulp stem cells (hDPSCs) in vitro.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze late complications of intraorbital Hydroxyapatite (HA) implants, specifically exposure occurring beyond ten years of implantation, and identify potential contributing factors.
results_summary: The study found that HA implant exposure occurred 10–19 years post-implantation, with complications including chronic infection, limited fibrovascular ingrowth, and poor prosthesis care. Most patients required implant removal, and histologic examination revealed chronic infection in 17 of 26 removed implants.
population_specificity: 38 Chinese patients with HA implant exposure after ten years of insertion.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a selenium-modified hydroxyapatite coating on titanium could enhance anti-tumor effects and promote bone regeneration in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC) patients.
results_summary: The study found that the selenium-modified hydroxyapatite coating successfully promoted osteogenic differentiation in rBMSCs and exhibited toxic effects on Cal27 tumor cells. The coating released ions steadily and increased osteogenic gene expression by 3-5 times.
population_specificity: In vitro study using rBMSCs (rat bone marrow stromal cells) and Cal27 (human HNSCC cell line).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Er:YAG laser pre-treatment on Ti-6Al-4V surfaces improves the adhesion of Hydroxyapatite (HAp) coatings.
results_summary: Laser treatment increased hardness and surface roughness but did not improve HAp coating adhesion compared to untreated machined surfaces. XRD, SEM, and EDS confirmed HAp coating formation.
population_specificity: In vitro study using Ti-6Al-4V discs.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a biocompatible and biodegradable delivery system using lipid-coated hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (LHAPNIRs) to improve the water solubility and tumor-targeting efficiency of the photothermal dye IR1061 for cancer therapy.
results_summary: The study found that ATRAM-LHAPNIRs (ALHAPNIRs) facilitated real-time thermal imaging and showed potent NIR-light triggered anticancer activity in vitro and in vivo, with no noticeable toxicity to healthy tissue. The nanoparticles effectively combined photothermal therapy (PTT) and diagnostic imaging capabilities.
population_specificity: Cancer cells (in vitro) and tumor-bearing animal models (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of hydroxyapatite nanomaterials for bone regeneration, focusing on biocompatibility, mechanical strength enhancement, and multifunctional applications like drug delivery and tumor therapy.
results_summary: Hydroxyapatite nanomaterials showed good biocompatibility, bioactivity, and osteointegration but required polymer and cross-linking agents to improve mechanical strength. The review highlighted their potential for bone regeneration, drug delivery, and tumor therapy, with 90 out of 293 articles meeting inclusion criteria.
population_specificity: Not specified (literature review of existing studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the combination of calcium hydroxyapatite (CaHA) and photobiomodulation (PBM) for bone regeneration, focusing on its bioactivity, biocompatibility, and healing potential.
results_summary: The systematic review found that CaHA combined with PBM shows promise for bone regeneration, with biphasic calcium phosphate being the most commonly used material. However, the study highlights the need for further research on soft tissue applications and standardized protocols.
population_specificity: Studies focused on bone regeneration, with no specific human or animal population detailed in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether chiral hierarchical structure hydroxyapatite (CHAP) nanoplates, particularly levorotatory-chiral HAP (L-CHAP), could modulate the immune microenvironment and promote tendon regeneration.
results_summary: L-CHAP nanoplates demonstrated good biocompatibility and bioactivity, inducing macrophage M2 polarization and enhancing efferocytosis, which reduced inflammatory damage to tendon stem cells and promoted tendon repair in a rat model of Achilles tendon injury.
population_specificity: Rat model of Achilles tendon injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of hydroxyapatite (HA)-loaded tricarboxylic cellulose/sodium alginate beads as scaffolds for bone tissue engineering.
results_summary: The study found that HA-loaded beads exhibited cytocompatibility with murine mesenchymal stem cells and demonstrated promising swellability and biodegradability properties, suggesting potential for bone regeneration applications.
population_specificity: Murine mesenchymal stem cells

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a carbon nanosphere-supported hydroxyapatite (HAP/CNS) adsorbent for immobilizing uranium (U(VI)) in wastewater.
results_summary: The HAP/CNS adsorbent demonstrated an ultra-high adsorption capacity (3080.3 mg/g) for U(VI), outperforming pure HAP and other reported adsorbents. The mechanism involved ion exchange, dissolution-precipitation forming calcium-uranium mica, and complexation via oxygen-containing functional groups.
population_specificity: Uranium-contaminated wastewater (no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop guidelines and recommendations for the prevention and management of complications associated with HA-CaHA hybrid injectable based on real-world clinical experience.
results_summary: The study provided treatment algorithms and best practices for managing HA-CaHA-related complications, emphasizing proper injection techniques and posttreatment care. Adverse events like skin discoloration and edema were discussed, with strategies for minimizing risks and optimizing patient outcomes.
population_specificity: European physicians and patients receiving HA-CaHA hybrid injectable treatments.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a hybrid bone scaffold combining hydroxyapatite (HAp) and BMP-2-loaded alginate beads, along with a barrier membrane, could effectively promote bone regeneration in long bone segmental defects.
results_summary: The BMP-2/HAp alginate bead group showed significantly improved bone volume, polar moment of inertia, and periosteal callus ossification, with reduced fibrous infiltration, while the BMP-2-unloaded HAp group exhibited membrane degradation and no hard callus formation. The hybrid scaffold provided sufficient osteoconductive and osteoinductive support for bone defect repair.
population_specificity: Nine rabbits with surgically created 10-mm radial segmental defects.
effective_dosage: Not specified (alginate beads containing HAp microparticles or BMP-2).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of two hydroxyapatite-based toothpastes (zinc carbonate hydroxyapatite vs. magnesium strontium carbonate hydroxyapatite with chitosan) in preventing dental caries and promoting oral health.
results_summary: Zinc-hydroxyapatite toothpaste showed significant short-term enamel remineralization (reduced DIAGNOdent scores) and plaque reduction, while magnesium strontium hydroxyapatite toothpaste had delayed plaque reduction effects. No significant improvements were observed in gingival inflammation or hypersensitivity.
population_specificity: Children and adolescents aged 6-18 years with healthy first permanent molars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a hydroxyapatite (HAP)-based scaffold loaded with rhBMP-2 in treating vertebral bone defects by enhancing osteogenic activity and bone regeneration.
results_summary: The HAP-HA-ALG scaffold improved compression resistance, extended rhBMP-2 half-life, enhanced osteoblast proliferation, and significantly promoted new bone formation and bone density in animal models.
population_specificity: Vertebral bone defect models (animal study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hydroxyapatite (HAP) toothpaste in preventing caries compared to fluoride toothpaste, placebo, or no intervention.
results_summary: The meta-analysis showed HAP toothpaste was significantly better than placebo for caries prevention (OR = 2.51) and slightly favored over fluoride toothpaste (OR = 1.1), though not statistically significant. In-situ studies also supported HAP for reducing lesion depth and bacterial loads, but remineralization results were non-significant.
population_specificity: Not specified (general population, inferred from clinical trials and in-situ studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the photocatalytic performance of erbium-doped hydroxyapatite-decorated titanium dioxide (TiO2@Er-Hap) in removing ciprofloxacin and methylene blue contaminants from water.
results_summary: TiO2@Er-Hap demonstrated high removal efficiency for methylene blue (100%) and ciprofloxacin (71.16%) under UV irradiation, maintained activity over five cycles, and produced non-toxic byproducts. The material exhibited a larger surface area and a band gap energy of 3.33 eV, with •OH radicals identified as the primary reactive species.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on water contaminants)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare phosphorus recovery performance and purity between hydroxyapatite (HAP) and magnesium ammonium phosphate (MAP) methods from sewage sludge thermal products.
results_summary: The study found that alkali leaching-HAP recovery yielded higher purity products compared to acid leaching-MAP, though with lower phosphorus content per unit mass. Hydroxyapatite products also had a higher market price, making HAP preferable for SA and PC.
population_specificity: Sewage sludge thermal products (smoldering ash, incineration ash, pyrolysis char).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the therapeutic potential of catechins-modified selenium-doped hydroxyapatite nanomaterials for targeted drug delivery and treatment of osteosarcoma.
results_summary: The study suggests that combining selenium and catechin with mesoporous hydroxyapatite nanoparticles shows promise as a nanoscale delivery method for treating bone-related diseases, offering improved osteogenic characteristics and antioxidant effects.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on osteosarcoma treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of oxygen vacancy-rich MnO2@hydroxyapatite core-shell nanospheres (Ov-MO@CPO) as a tumor microenvironment-responsive sonosensitizer for sonodynamic immunotherapy.
results_summary: Ov-MO@CPO demonstrated pH-sensitive dissolution in acidic tumor microenvironments, releasing MnO2 to alleviate hypoxia and boost ROS production, effectively reversing immunosuppression and inhibiting tumor growth and metastasis in 4T1 tumor-bearing mice with no evident toxicity.
population_specificity: 4T1 tumor-bearing mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of micro and nano hydroxyapatite (µ-HAp and n-HAp) and carbon nanofibers (CNFs) on poly(ε-caprolactone) (PCL) composites for potential use in bone tissue engineering.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite additives influenced the crystallization of PCL, with n-HAp (15 wt%) and CNFs showing the most uniform apatite coverage, indicating high bioactivity for bone tissue engineering applications. The type and content of HAp affected the polymer matrix differently, with CNFs causing the highest amorphousness and hydrophobicity.
population_specificity: In vitro study (simulated body fluid)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (nHAPs) synthesized from poultry bones as phosphorus fertilizers, comparing their solubility and leaching potential to conventional fertilizers.
results_summary: nHAP700 showed higher phosphorus solubility than nHAP300, with both types demonstrating lower phosphorus leaching compared to triple superphosphate (TSP). Pseudomonas alloputida effectively solubilized the nanoparticles, indicating potential for sustainable phosphorus recycling.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and soil leaching tests)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the structural, magnetic, and thermal properties of nickel-substituted hydroxyapatite (Ni:HAp) thin films for potential use in magnetic hyperthermia treatment of bone cancer.
results_summary: The study found that Ni:HAp thin films exhibited ferromagnetic behavior and achieved desired thermal responses under an alternating magnetic field within 80 seconds, with strong binding affinities observed in protein-ligand interactions. The material showed 46% degradation at 800 °C, indicating thermal stability, and demonstrated potential for targeted cancer cell heating while preserving healthy tissue.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied).
effective_dosage: Not specified (laser pulses in the range of 30,000-60,000 used for deposition).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of Yttrium-90 hydroxyapatite radionuclide synovectomy in improving joint functionality in patients with drug-resistant inflammatory arthritis.
results_summary: Significant improvements were observed in joint restriction, pain severity, VAS, and swelling at 2 and 6 months post-treatment. Adverse events were minor and resolved with conservative treatment.
population_specificity: Patients with drug-resistant inflammatory arthritis of the knee.
effective_dosage: Intra-articular injections of Yttrium-90 hydroxyapatite along with triamcinolone (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of electrospinning collagen membranes blended with nanophased hydroxyapatite (nHA) in augmenting gingival thickness on the buccal side of canine teeth.
results_summary: The study found that PLCL/F-Fg/20%nHA membranes significantly increased gingival thickness and reduced volume loss compared to PLCL/F-Fg and PLCL/F-Fg/10%nHA membranes, demonstrating effectiveness in soft tissue augmentation.
population_specificity: Adult beagle dogs with surgically altered mandibular premolars.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the combined effect of nanocrystalline hydroxyapatite (Nano-HA) with titanium-platelet rich fibrin (T-PRF) for ridge preservation after tooth extraction.
results_summary: The study found that Nano-HA + T-PRF resulted in significant bone fill and adequate ridge width preservation, with a mean bone density of 776.72 ± 223.94 after 14-16 weeks, comparable to the DMBM + T-PRF group. The combination of T-PRF with bone grafts yielded effective results in minimizing alveolar bone resorption.
population_specificity: Twenty systemically healthy patients requiring tooth extraction and ridge preservation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an antibiotic-free, collagen silver-doped hydroxyapatite (coll-AgHA) scaffold with enhanced mechanical and antimicrobial properties for preventing osteomyelitis in load-bearing bone defects.
results_summary: The optimized coll-AgHA scaffold demonstrated in vitro osteogenic and antibacterial properties against S. aureus, and in vivo implantation showed enhanced bone repair, vessel formation, and calcified tissue in a rat model of load-bearing critical-sized defects.
population_specificity: Rats with load-bearing critical-sized bone defects.
effective_dosage: 1.5 mol% Ag in AgHA particles, 200 wt% AgHA concentration within the collagen scaffold.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Ochrobactrum anthropic could enhance the immobilization of heavy metals (Cd, Pb, As) in Fe-HAP-amended soils by improving phosphate and iron release.
results_summary: The combination of O. anthropic and Fe-HAP significantly increased residual fractions of Cd, Pb, and As, improved soil nutrient availability, and shifted bacterial community composition toward beneficial generalists.
population_specificity: Lead-zinc smelting site soils contaminated with heavy metals.
effective_dosage: 2% O. anthropic (v/w) and Fe-HAP (Fe-to-HAP ratio of 1:1).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the use of nano-hydroxyapatite (nHA) as a potential nanocarrier for the tocotrienol-rich fraction (TRF) to improve its oral bioavailability.
results_summary: The study successfully optimized the formulation of nHA-encapsulated TRF, achieving an average particle size of ~270 nm, a negative zeta potential of ~-20 mV, and an encapsulation efficiency of ~18.1%. The results suggest nHA could be an effective nanocarrier for TRF delivery.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or preclinical study implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate an oxidative hydrothermal treatment method for producing hydroxyapatite (HA) from bone waste, comparing its efficiency and properties to conventional calcination.
results_summary: The study successfully recovered HA with <1 wt% organic content at lower temperatures and shorter durations than calcination, while achieving higher specific surface area (up to 164 m²/g), beneficial for biomedical and sorbent applications. Organic matter degradation was confirmed via TGA-DSC, FTIR, TOC, and Raman spectroscopy.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using animal bone waste).
study_duration: Varied dwelling times (0 and 2 hours) at temperatures of 220, 250, and 280°C.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether administering nanoemulsion carbonated hydroxyapatite-statin (CHA-statin) would increase Runx-2 expression and decrease Acp 5 expression in rats experiencing experimental orthodontic relapse.
results_summary: The CHA-statin group showed a significant reduction in Acp 5-positive cells and higher Runx-2 expression compared to other groups, suggesting potential prevention of orthodontic relapse in rats.
population_specificity: 48 rats divided into four groups (control, CHA, statin, and CHA-statin).
effective_dosage: Administered intrasulcularly every 3 days for 7 days (specific dosage not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to design and evaluate daidzein-loaded hydroxyapatite nanoparticles as a novel therapy for osteoporosis in menopausal women, mimicking synthetic estrogens and biomineralization.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite nanoparticles effectively delivered daidzein with high entrapment efficiency (87.23%) and sustained release (91% over 90 hours), significantly increasing bioavailability (three-fold higher AUC compared to daidzein solution). The nanoparticles demonstrated thermal stability and compatibility.
population_specificity: Menopausal women (inferred from osteoporosis focus, though specific study population details are not provided in the abstract).
study_duration: Not specified in the abstract (in vitro release studied over 90 hours; in vivo pharmacokinetic data timeframe not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a faster bioactive material mimicking hydroxyapatite's structure while surpassing its bioactivity and to explore the properties of silicorhenanite phases.
results_summary: The study successfully developed bioactive glass particles (Sili 900 and Sili 1000) with enhanced bioactivity and compatibility compared to hydroxyapatite, confirmed by in vitro and in vivo tests. Sili 1000 showed rapid ionic leaching and improved clotting ability, making it a potential drug carrier.
population_specificity: NIH 3T3 fibroblasts (in vitro) and wound healing models (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review surface modification techniques and additives to enhance the mechanical strength, biocompatibility, and durability of Hydroxyapatite nanocoatings for prosthetic orthopedic implants.
results_summary: The study found that various deposition methods and selective additives improve Hydroxyapatite's tribological characteristics, wear resistance, and mechanical strength without compromising biocompatibility, suggesting potential advancements in bone tissue engineering.
population_specificity: Prosthetic orthopedic implants (e.g., Ti6Al4V titanium alloys).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a biphasic ceramic bone substitute (BCBS) containing hydroxyapatite (HA) and calcium sulfate as a treatment for aneurysmal bone cysts (ABCs) when surgery is not feasible.
results_summary: A single injection of BCBS led to complete cyst ossification, cortical bone remodeling, and spinal canal restoration in a 6-month follow-up, demonstrating its potential as an effective alternative to selective arterial embolization and Denosumab.
population_specificity: A young woman with a C2 aneurysmal bone cyst.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop Ag2O-loaded hydroxyapatite nanocomposites for photocatalytic degradation of Rhodamine B dye in water and assess their stability and efficiency under visible and UV-visible light.
results_summary: The nanocomposites showed efficient photocatalytic degradation of RhB dye, with improved stability of Ag2O when loaded into hydroxyapatite, which acted as an electron sink and porous matrix for by-products. The composites demonstrated practical potential for water contamination remediation under various light sources.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of combining nanoemulsion extract of purple leaves and hydroxyapatite on osteogenic markers (RUNX2, OSX, OPN, ALP) and calcium deposition.
results_summary: The combination significantly increased the expression of osteogenic markers and calcium deposition compared to control groups, with statistically significant results (P < 0.05) observed on days 7, 14, and 21.
population_specificity: Adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells (Ad-MSCs) in vitro.
effective_dosage: 1% and 2% nano-extract of purple leaves combined with hydroxyapatite.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the integration of Hydroxyapatite (HAP) crystallization with partial denitrification/Anammox (PD/A) for simultaneous nitrogen and phosphorus removal and recovery in wastewater treatment.
results_summary: The study achieved high nitrogen (94.13%) and phosphorus (73.6%) removal efficiencies, with HAP identified as the main inorganic component of granules. Metagenomic analysis showed increased abundance of Candidatus Brocadia (1% to 26.1%) and upregulated genes (sdh, suc, hzs), enhancing microbial activity.
population_specificity: Wastewater treatment systems (not human or animal subjects).
effective_dosage: Not specified (adjustments made to pH, sludge concentration, COD/TN ratio, and dissolved oxygen stress).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to estimate the radiation absorbed dose of 166Ho-hydroxyapatite (166Ho-HA) for liver cancer treatment and assess its biodistribution and safety in normal tissues.
results_summary: The study found that 166Ho-HA delivers over 84% of the absorbed dose to liver tissue while sparing healthy tissues, with a maximum tolerable dose of 6.13 GBq for the liver. The effective dose was 0.39 mSv MBq-1, indicating promising efficacy for liver malignancies.
population_specificity: Adult men (based on biodistribution data from normal Wistar rats).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize Hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (HANPs), assess their renal toxicity, and evaluate the protective effects of red pigment (RP) from Monascus purpureus against HANPs-induced kidney damage.
results_summary: HANPs caused renal toxicity, oxidative stress, inflammation, and apoptosis in rats, while co-treatment with RP mitigated these adverse effects in a dose-dependent manner.
population_specificity: Adult male rats
effective_dosage: HANPs at 88.3 mg/kg; RP at 10, 20, and 40 mg/kg (daily oral gavage)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of mollusk shell-derived hydroxyapatite as a bioactive, osteoconductive material for dental applications, focusing on its synthesis, properties, and clinical relevance.
results_summary: The study found that mollusk shell-derived hydroxyapatite exhibits notable bioactivity, osteoconductivity, and osteoinductivity without adverse immune reactions, making it suitable for bone graft substitutes and dental implant coatings. Thermal and chemical synthesis methods were highlighted for producing highly crystalline and pure materials.
population_specificity: Not specified (general focus on dental applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to establish reference data on tooth root length and post-extraction alveolar volume in dogs to guide the use of hydroxyapatite-based bone substitute materials for filling extraction sites.
results_summary: The study found a correlation between tooth length and alveolar volume in dogs of different weight ranges, enabling calculation of the required volume of hydroxyapatite-based material for post-extraction filling. It also reviewed commercially available hydroxyapatite materials and provided a method to determine the necessary volume for clinical use.
population_specificity: Mature dogs in weight ranges of 1-5 kg, 5-10 kg, 10-20 kg, and over 20 kg.
effective_dosage: Not specified (volume calculated based on alveolar size).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the formulation, quality control, and clinical effectiveness of [90Y]Y-labeled hydroxyapatite microparticles for radiation synovectomy in treating inflammatory joint diseases.
results_summary: The study demonstrated high radiochemical purity (>99.0%) and consistent quality across 20 batches, with clinical effectiveness in managing inflammatory joint diseases in over 100 patients. Post-treatment investigations confirmed the formulation's efficacy.
population_specificity: Patients suffering from inflammatory joint diseases, primarily affecting the knee joints.
