study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a piezoelectric ceramic scaffold incorporating hydroxyapatite (HA) for repairing infected bone defects, assessing its antibacterial, osteogenic, and angiogenic properties.
results_summary: The scaffold demonstrated potent antibacterial capabilities and enhanced osteogenic and angiogenic potential under low-intensity pulsed ultrasound (LIPUS), with the EGR1 gene identified as potentially crucial in the process.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the regenerative potential of hydroxyapatite-based biomaterials, with or without mesenchymal stem cells, in treating bone defects in an ovine model.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite-based biomaterials demonstrated osteoconduction and biocompatibility, promoting bone formation in tibial defects, with no significant difference between enriched and non-enriched groups.
population_specificity: Female Suffolk sheep with induced tibial defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the optical properties and cell viability effects of samarium-doped nanohydroxyapatite (Sm/HAp) in SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells for potential nerve regeneration and bioimaging applications.
results_summary: The study confirmed successful integration of Sm3+ ions into hydroxyapatite, with emission properties influenced by Sm3+ content and thermal treatment. Cell viability studies showed a concentration- and particle size-dependent response, suggesting potential for regenerative applications.
population_specificity: SH-SY5Y neuroblastoma cells (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Sm3+ concentrations varied (0 ≤ x ≤ 1 in Ca10-x Sm x (PO4)6(OH)2), with maximum emission at Sm = 0.05

study_goal: The researchers aimed to synthesize and compare hydroxyapatite (HAp) from fish scales of two species (Tenualosa ilisha and Labeo rohita) and evaluate its structural, compositional, and biocompatibility properties.
results_summary: The study successfully synthesized highly crystalline HAp with distinct crystal structures (monoclinic for I-HAp, hexagonal for R-HAp) and confirmed bioactivity through apatite layer formation in simulated body fluid. Both samples demonstrated biocompatibility based on cell viability and hemocompatibility studies.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study using fish scales).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate carbonated hydroxyapatite's mineral induction ability and in vitro cytotoxicity with human dental pulp cells to assess its potential as a dental pulp-capping material.
results_summary: The study found that carbonated hydroxyapatite samples were bioactive with varying apatite formation, and in vitro cytotoxicity assays showed over 70% cell viability, suggesting potential suitability for dental applications.
population_specificity: Human dental pulp cells (in vitro study)
effective_dosage: Not specified (different levels of carbonate substitution were tested)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate arginine-modified hydroxyapatite nanoparticles (R-HAp) as a non-viral vector for delivering the dystrophin gene in Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD) gene therapy.
results_summary: R-HAp nanoparticles effectively bound and delivered the dystrophin plasmid to DMD patient-derived skeletal muscle cells, showing sustained gene expression up to 5 days post-transfection and dystrophin protein production after 7 days. The results suggest R-HAp as a promising alternative to traditional viral vectors for DMD treatment.
population_specificity: DMD patient-derived skeletal muscle cells and mouse myotubes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nano-hydroxyapatite synthesized from Conus litteratus seashells (Ss/nHAp) as an adsorbent for removing Congo Red dye from aqueous solutions.
results_summary: The study found that Ss/nHAp effectively removed 85% of Congo Red dye within 10 minutes under optimal conditions, with a maximum adsorption capacity of 24 mg g-1. The material maintained 74% efficiency after five regeneration cycles, demonstrating reusability.
population_specificity: Aqueous solutions contaminated with Congo Red dye (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to optimize the deposition process of Hydroxyapatite (HAp) coatings on Ti6Al4V alloy substrates using matrix-assisted pulsed laser evaporation (MAPLE) to improve deposition speed, quality, and uniformity.
results_summary: The study successfully deposited uniform HAp coatings (approx. 200 nm for water/isopropanol, 320 nm for isopropanol:acetonitrile) without further treatment, achieving a 37% increase in deposition rate. The coatings met requirements for biocompatibility testing and composite synthesis.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on Ti6Al4V alloy substrates).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate hydroxyapatite zirconium nanoparticles (HApZr) as photosensitizer candidates for X-ray-induced photodynamic therapy in lung cancer treatment.
results_summary: HApZr nanoparticles increased intracellular ROS levels and cytotoxicity in cancer cells after irradiation, showed promising cellular uptake, and demonstrated good accumulation in target organs with minor acute toxicity at 50 μg/mL.
population_specificity: Orthotopic lung cancer mouse models and in vitro cancer cell lines.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether ColII-HA-CS-HAP scaffolds combined with BMSCs could effectively repair cartilage defects in a rabbit knee model.
results_summary: The study found that ColII-HA-CS-HAP scaffolds with BMSCs promoted rapid cell growth and produced regenerated cartilage more similar to native cartilage compared to scaffolds alone after 6 months.
population_specificity: Rabbits with induced knee cartilage defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a novel HAP-Alg composite dressing for acute wound treatment, focusing on mechanical properties, wound protection, and therapeutic effects.
results_summary: The HAP-Alg composite dressing demonstrated excellent mechanical properties, bacterial shielding, and moisturizing effects, promoting angiogenesis, re-epithelialization, and reduced scar formation. In vitro and in vivo studies confirmed its biocompatibility, cell migration enhancement, and wound closure acceleration.
population_specificity: Acute wound models (in vivo) and cell studies (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate a novel composite material combining hydroxyapatite nanoparticles with a titanium(IV)-metal-organic framework for dual antimicrobial activity and bone regeneration.
results_summary: The composite demonstrated high cytocompatibility, enhanced antibacterial efficacy against Staphylococcus aureus and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and improved mechanical properties compared to unmodified hydroxyapatite.
population_specificity: In vitro assays using osteoblasts (U2-OS) and fibroblasts (L929).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and infection-related outcomes of calcium sulfate/hydroxyapatite combined with Gentamicin (CaS/HA-G) in treating osteomyelitis.
results_summary: The study found that CaS/HA-G was effective in eradicating infection in 95.2% of patients (20 out of 21), with a median eradication time of 128 days. The treatment also served as an absorbable bone void filler.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18 and older diagnosed with osteomyelitis requiring surgical intervention.
study_duration: Median follow-up period of 10 months (range 7-16 months)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the safety, aesthetic results, and early osteointegration of customized hydroxyapatite porous ceramics for skull reconstruction after tumor resection.
results_summary: The study found high early osteointegration rates (72.2% at 6 weeks, increasing to 82.6% at 3 months) and high patient satisfaction, indicating effective bone regeneration and aesthetic outcomes.
population_specificity: 14 patients (13 adults and 1 child) with skull bone infiltrating lesions.
study_duration: Follow-up at 6 weeks and 3 months post-surgery

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of different bioreactor systems (including RCCS/EMF) for osteochondral tissue engineering using chitosan/gelatin/nano-hydroxyapatite scaffolds.
results_summary: The RCCS/EMF culture system showed the highest cellular proliferation and differentiation, with significantly elevated expression of chondrogenic and osteogenic factors. In vivo, RCCS/EMF-treated constructs promoted the best osteochondral tissue repair in rabbits, closely resembling natural tissue.
population_specificity: New Zealand rabbits with femoral condylar defects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of ultraporous permanently polarized hydroxyapatite (upp-HAp) as a green catalyst for sustainable urea synthesis via the Bazarov reaction under mild conditions.
results_summary: The study found that upp-HAp effectively catalyzed urea synthesis with 97% selectivity under mild conditions (95-120°C, 1 bar CO2), achieving an efficiency of ~2% for NH3 and ~30% for CO2. Results suggest the double-step approach may be more advantageous for urea synthesis and CO2 revalorization.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro/catalytic study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the structural and chemical properties of copper-doped hydroxyapatite (HA) and its optical characteristics under different synthesis conditions.
results_summary: The study found that copper incorporation in HA leads to distinct color changes (violet to blue) and structural modifications, with Cu+ ions stabilizing in hexagonal tunnels and Cu2+ ions substituting calcium sites, inducing Jahn-Teller distortion. The redox behavior and Cu-O-Cu interactions persist regardless of copper's valence state.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize sodium alginate/hydroxyapatite scaffolds reinforced with zinc oxide nanoparticles for bone tissue engineering, assessing their structural, mechanical, and bioactive properties.
results_summary: The scaffolds showed over 70% porosity, increased compressive strength with higher ZnO-NP content, enhanced bioactivity, and strong antibacterial activity against E. coli and S. aureus. An artificial neural network also predicted relationships between scaffold properties, confirming experimental results.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the size effect of biological hydroxyapatite (BHA) on bone biomimicry and its influence on bone repair and regeneration through osteo-coagulo-immunomodulation.
results_summary: The study found that BHA size influences bone biomimicry hierarchy and affects bone repair outcomes via osteo-coagulo-immunomodulation, proposing a new understanding of size effects in biomaterials for clinical applications.
population_specificity: Not specified (clinical bone defect treatment context implied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of biochar-supported nano-hydroxyapatite on cadmium (Cd) remediation in soil and its impact on pepper plant growth across different growth stages.
results_summary: The study found that applying nBC3 (biochar-supported nano-hydroxyapatite) at an 11% mass ratio significantly reduced soil Cd content by 57.6% and fixed it by 77%, while also decreasing Cd accumulation in pepper plants by 36.6%. Soil pH, organic matter, and phosphorus were key factors influencing Cd fixation.
population_specificity: Cadmium-contaminated soil and pepper plants (Capsicum annuum).
study_duration: Entire cultivation cycle (seedling, flowering, and maturity stages).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a composite aerogel containing hydroxyapatite nanowires (HAPnws) could improve adsorption efficiency for viscous organic liquids, particularly in oil spill scenarios.
results_summary: The PI/HAP/rGO aerogel demonstrated superior adsorption efficiency for oils of varying viscosities due to reduced flow tortuosity and photothermal properties, along with excellent fire resistance and reusability.
population_specificity: Not applicable (material science study, no human or animal subjects).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to update a previous meta-analysis to evaluate the effectiveness of hydroxyapatite in oral care products for reducing dental caries, comparing it to placebo, no intervention, or fluoride-containing controls.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that hydroxyapatite-containing oral care products are effective in reducing dental caries, with evidence from both RCTs and in situ trials supporting its efficacy as a fluoride-free alternative. The clinical significance highlights hydroxyapatite as a safe and suitable substitute for fluoride, especially for young children.
population_specificity: Subjects of all ages with primary, mixed, or permanent dentitions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how different methods of applying cucurbit[6]uril (CB[6]) to hydroxyapatite (HA) surfaces affect the material's properties and morphology for potential biomedical applications.
results_summary: The study found that four different modification methods produced HA composites with distinct surface morphologies, which were characterized using IR spectroscopy and SEM. The results suggest that CB[6] application methods can be tailored to adjust the composition and structure of HA composites, enhancing their versatility and biocompatibility.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of ion-doped hydroxyapatite nanoparticles on cell metabolism, oxidative stress, and DNA damage in human osteoblast-like cells.
results_summary: The study found that hydroxyapatite nanoparticles enhanced cell metabolism but partially limited cell proliferation. Iron-doped HA slightly increased reactive oxygen species production, while magnesium-doped HA had no effect. DNA damage was observed, which was enhanced by chitosan, suggesting it modulates the nanoparticles' biological activity.
population_specificity: Human osteoblast-like cells (MG63 and HOBIT).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if iodine-substituted hydroxyapatite (IHAP) nanomaterials could serve as a proton radiation tracer for range verification in mineralized tissues during proton therapy.
results_summary: The study successfully synthesized IHAP nanomaterials with varying iodine concentrations, identified an optimal high-iodine pure apatite phase, and demonstrated proton beam activation, suggesting potential for dose and range verification in proton therapy.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate therapeutic strategies, including those targeting hydroxyapatite formation, to attenuate vascular and valvular calcification in chronic kidney disease (CKD).
results_summary: Strategies targeting hydroxyapatite formation, such as sodium thiosulphate and hexasodium fytate, show promise but require further evaluation. The study highlights conflicting results with conventional therapies and inconsistent findings with magnesium and vitamin K supplementation.
population_specificity: People with chronic kidney disease (CKD) experiencing vascular and valvular calcification.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of vitamin K2 (VK2) supplementation on bone mineral density (BMD) and fracture incidence in postmenopausal women, indirectly assessing hydroxyapatite's role in bone mineralization.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that VK2 supplementation significantly improved lumbar spine BMD, reduced fracture incidence, and lowered serum uncarboxylated osteocalcin (uc-OC) levels, suggesting indirect promotion of bone mineralization via hydroxyapatite binding.
population_specificity: Postmenopausal women (6,425 subjects across 16 RCTs).

study_goal: To determine whether vitamin D supplementation has a dose-dependent effect on the development and progression of arterial calcification (measured via hydroxyapatite).
results_summary: The study found no differential effects on arterial calcification progression across vitamin D dosages (400, 4000, or 10,000 IU/day). Calcification increased linearly over time, but no new calcifications developed, and treatment group had no significant impact.
population_specificity: Community-dwelling adults aged 55-70 years with baseline serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D levels of 30-125 nmol/L.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the role of magnesium in inhibiting hydroxyapatite formation and its potential protective effects against vascular calcification in CKD patients.
results_summary: The study found that magnesium inhibits hydroxyapatite formation and pathogenic calciprotein particles, potentially protecting against vascular calcification, though clinical trial results were contradictory.
population_specificity: Chronic kidney disease (CKD) patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the association between undercarboxylated osteocalcin (ucOC) and lower-limb muscle strength in elderly women, as well as the relationship between bone turnover markers and heel ultrasound measures, using hydroxyapatite pre-treatment for ucOC quantification.
results_summary: The study found that ucOC% (but not absolute ucOC concentration) was positively associated with hip flexor, hip abductor, and quadriceps muscle strength, and negatively associated with α-ACT. Total osteocalcin (tOC) was linked to bone turnover markers but inversely associated with heel ultrasound measures (BUA, SOS, and SI).
population_specificity: Women over the age of 70 years.

study_goal: To determine the radiographic arthrodesis rates after instrumented lumbar posterolateral fusions using local autograft, bone marrow aspirate, and nanocrystalline hydroxyapatite.
results_summary: The study found high radiographic arthrodesis rates (91% of patients, 94% of segments) with nanocrystalline hydroxyapatite, comparable to iliac crest autograft. Clinical outcomes were excellent or good for 77% of patients, with no complications related to the graft mass or symptomatic nonunions.
population_specificity: 46 patients undergoing 1-segment, 2-segment, or 3-segment instrumented posterolateral lumbar fusions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of hydroxyapatite-coated implants as a technology to improve osteoporotic fracture fixation.
results_summary: The abstract mentions hydroxyapatite-coated implants as a promising technology for treating osteoporotic fractures, but no specific results or outcomes related to hydroxyapatite are detailed.
population_specificity: Osteoporotic fracture patients (implied, not explicitly stated).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of PLGA/HA (an alloplastic graft material containing hydroxyapatite) with deproteinized bovine bone (DBB) in maxillary sinus-lift surgery.
results_summary: PLGA/HA showed equivalent vertical bone regeneration but significantly lower bone density compared to DBB. Despite this, PLGA/HA was deemed clinically sufficient for sinus-lift surgery, though further histologic and micromorphometric studies are needed.
population_specificity: Human patients undergoing maxillary sinus-lift surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine Hydroxyapatite's interactions with mutans streptococci (MS) and its effects on bacterial adherence, as well as its in vivo application for improving oral hygiene.
results_summary: The study found that salivary components inhibited MS adhesion to Hydroxyapatite, except for SRCRP2, and that HA treatment reduced MS adherence to enamel surfaces by one-third. In vivo application of HA dentifrice gradually decreased the MS/TS colony ratio in saliva.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro and in vivo study, likely human subjects for in vivo portion).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to describe the demographic and clinical characteristics of Nerva app users, examine usage patterns, and explore factors associated with program persistence for gut-directed hypnotherapy (GDH) in IBS patients.
results_summary: The study found promising adherence rates (31% persistence) for the Nerva app program within six weeks, with a small but significant association between age and program persistence. Prevalence estimates of IBS aligned with previous literature, and user/clinical characteristics were linked to persistence.
population_specificity: 14,898 individuals (77.2% female, mean age 38.59 years) with IBS who downloaded and used the Nerva app.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore cancer patients' perceptions of hypnotherapy and identify barriers to its integration into cancer care.
results_summary: Participants recognized hypnotherapy's potential for emotional and physical support, though its primary use was for emotional well-being. Barriers included cost and lack of information, while healthcare provider attitudes influenced patient decisions.
population_specificity: 14 adult cancer patients (breast, lung, and colorectal) undergoing active treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore challenges faced by transgender or gender-diverse individuals in gut-directed hypnotherapy, focusing on body awareness, vulnerability, and external barriers.
results_summary: The study identified four main themes: distress from body awareness, difficulty with vulnerability, the importance of gender-affirming supports, and external barriers, suggesting that hypnotherapy may be challenging for this population without additional considerations.
population_specificity: Transgender or gender-diverse individuals who discontinued gut-directed hypnotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the effects of hypnotherapy during childbirth preparation on pain, fear, and overall childbirth experience.
results_summary: Hypnotherapy demonstrated benefits in reducing fear and pain during labor and improved the overall childbirth experience. The study reviewed high-quality RCTs, showing consistent positive outcomes.
population_specificity: Pregnant individuals preparing for childbirth.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to characterize the demographics, hot flash severity, sleep quality, and mental health of users of the Evia hypnotherapy app and explore relationships between hot flash frequency and anxiety/depression.
results_summary: The study found that a significant portion of Evia app users experienced frequent hot flashes, poor sleep quality, and anxiety/depression, with a small negative correlation between hot flash frequency and anxiety/depression.
population_specificity: Women experiencing hot flashes, with a mean age of 49.31 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of a hypnotherapy group program for smoking cessation with a cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) program in a randomized controlled trial.
results_summary: Hypnotherapy showed comparable continuous abstinence rates to CBT (15.0% vs. 15.6%), but CBT had significantly higher 7-day abstinence rates when controlling for hypnotic suggestibility. Overall, hypnotherapy's efficacy for smoking cessation appeared similar to established CBT programs.
population_specificity: 360 smokers willing to quit, randomly assigned to hypnotherapy or CBT.
effective_dosage: One 90-minute group session per week for 6 weeks.
study_duration: 6 weeks of intervention, with follow-up over 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to provide a comprehensive overview of studies exploring hypnotherapy as a treatment for depression, assessing its effectiveness and usage patterns.
results_summary: Hypnotherapy was found effective in reducing depression symptoms, often outperforming antidepressants in areas like overall health and vitality, though further controlled studies are needed to confirm efficacy.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-70, with a higher proportion of female participants.
study_duration: Ranged from short-term (3 sessions) to long-term (20 weekly sessions).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of audio hypnotherapy on psychological well-being, exclusive breastfeeding behavior, and OXTR gene expression in mothers of infants aged 0-6 months.
results_summary: The study found significant improvements in psychological condition, exclusive breastfeeding behavior, and OXTR protein and mRNA expression in the intervention group compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Breastfeeding mothers with infants aged 0-6 months in Indonesia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to distinguish pseudoscientific claims from evidence-based uses of hypnotherapy and evaluate its legitimacy and usefulness in medical applications.
results_summary: The study found that pseudoscientific claims based on outdated theories have delegitimized hypnotherapy, while modern evidence-based approaches have re-established its use for treating physical and mental health disorders, particularly for irritable bowel syndrome. Hypnotherapy can be unethical as a pseudoscience but effective as an evidence-based treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion of medical and psychological applications).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether mindful hypnotherapy effectively improves emotion regulation, mindfulness, and mental health in patients with major depressive disorder.
results_summary: The study found that mindful hypnotherapy significantly reduced difficulties in emotion regulation and significantly increased mindfulness and mental health scores in the intervention group, with effects sustained at a two-month follow-up.
population_specificity: Thirty-four patients with major depressive disorder referred by clinical psychologists in Tehran, Iran.
study_duration: Not specified (follow-up was two months post-intervention)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the importance of the patient's role in hypnotherapy, particularly through self-hypnosis, and its equivalence to hetero-hypnosis.
results_summary: The study found that self-hypnosis is largely indistinguishable from hetero-hypnosis and equally effective, emphasizing the role of phenomenological control by the patient, which could enhance self-efficacy and treatment uptake.
population_specificity: Not specified (general discussion, no specific population studied).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether baseline patient characteristics could predict response to gut-directed hypnotherapy in patients with refractory IBS.
results_summary: The study found that 76.3% of patients achieved a significant reduction in IBS symptoms, with responders having higher baseline non-colonic symptom scores. Patients with higher baseline IBS-SSS and lower depression scores were more likely to improve in abdominal pain, while higher anxiety scores were associated with dropout.
population_specificity: 448 patients with refractory Rome III IBS.
study_duration: Not explicitly stated, but compared 6 vs. 12 sessions.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of gut-directed hypnotherapy as an alternative method for managing inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) symptoms.
results_summary: The study found mixed results, with one small trial reporting significant remission at one year, but larger trials showed no significant gastrointestinal improvements. Psychological outcomes did not differ between hypnotherapy and control groups.
population_specificity: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), including ulcerative colitis.
interactions: Possible influence from simultaneous use of two drugs alongside hypnotherapy in one case series.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if hypnotherapy (HT) was superior to a waitlist control group (WL) in reducing agoraphobia-related symptoms and to explore feasibility, attrition rates, and potential genetic variables influencing treatment outcomes.
results_summary: Hypnotherapy showed a higher symptom reduction compared to the waitlist group in the intention-to-treat analysis, with low dropout rates and high patient satisfaction. The COMT Val108/158Met genotype influenced symptom outcomes and DNA methylation levels.
population_specificity: 36 patients diagnosed with agoraphobia.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether hypnotherapy could serve as a valid alternative to nitrous oxide for managing anxiety and fear in children undergoing dental treatment.
results_summary: Hypnotherapy was found to be a viable substitute for nitrous oxide in pediatric dentistry, with subjective and objective pain assessments (VAS and FLACC scales, heart rate) comparing favorably between the hypnotherapy and nitrous oxide groups. The control group, treated with classic behavioral techniques, served as a baseline for comparison.
population_specificity: 150 children (90 males, 60 females) undergoing dental treatment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and acceptability of virtually delivered gut-directed hypnotherapy as an adjunctive treatment for adults with Crohn's disease.
results_summary: Virtually delivered hypnotherapy was highly acceptable to participants, with high satisfaction (73%) and session completion (88%), despite technical issues. Recruitment and objective data collection were challenging, but online assessments showed high completion rates (97-100%).
population_specificity: Adults with Crohn's disease.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to comprehensively identify and evaluate studies examining the effectiveness of hypnotherapy for treating sleep disturbances in adults.
results_summary: 47.7% of studies showed positive results for hypnotherapy's impact on sleep, 22.7% showed mixed results, and 29.5% showed no impact. A subset of studies focusing on sleep-specific suggestions had more favorable outcomes, with 54.5% showing positive results.
population_specificity: Adult populations with sleep disturbances.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term efficacy of hypnotherapy (HT) with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for treating mild to moderate depressive episodes.
results_summary: The study found that HT was noninferior to CBT in reducing depressive symptoms, with improvements persisting during a 3.5-year follow-up. Response and remission rates were comparable between HT and CBT in both self- and clinician-ratings.
population_specificity: 152 patients with mild to moderate depressive episodes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the safety and efficacy of a self-administered digital gut-directed hypnotherapy (GDH) program versus digital muscle relaxation (MR) in adults with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
results_summary: Digital GDH showed a significant improvement in abdominal pain response during the last 4 weeks of treatment and over the entire treatment period compared to MR, with no serious adverse events reported. Both groups showed similar primary endpoint responses, but GDH had better sustained pain relief.
population_specificity: Adults with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS).
effective_dosage: Not specified (digital program accessed via mobile app).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore individuals' experiences with hypnotherapy for weight loss and identify perceived barriers and facilitators for healthy lifestyle changes.
results_summary: Participants reported that hypnotherapy aided weight loss by promoting mindful eating and increasing motivation for lifestyle changes, though barriers like high costs of healthy foods and lack of social support were noted. Hypnotherapy was deemed useful as an adjunct tool for weight management.
population_specificity: 15 participants (11 women, 4 men; mean age 23 years) from a public university in Terengganu, Malaysia, who lost ≥5% weight after hypnotherapy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of cognitive hypnotherapy for anxiety disorders using a neural network model (DBN) to assess intervention outcomes.
results_summary: The study demonstrated high accuracy of the DBN model in evaluating cognitive hypnotherapy's effectiveness for anxiety disorders, suggesting it as a promising intervention. The model's parameters were optimized through experiments, and results aligned with expert evaluations.
population_specificity: Anxiety disorder patients

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the latest literature on remote hypnotherapy, comparing its efficacy, patient satisfaction, and practical considerations to face-to-face therapy.
results_summary: Remote hypnotherapy via video is more popular and effective than telephone therapy, acceptable to patients, and improves access compared to face-to-face therapy, though patient choice remains important for some cases.
population_specificity: Not specified (general international adoption).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically scope existing research on the use of hypnosis for chronic pelvic pain, quality of life, anxiety, depression, and fatigue.
results_summary: Meta-analysis of RCTs found no significant difference in pain or quality of life between hypnotherapy and control groups. Only one study reported pain reduction, but it did not outperform controls, with limitations due to lack of standardized interventions and study heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic pelvic pain.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of medical hypnotherapy for treating various pediatric diseases and symptoms, highlighting its effectiveness across different specialties.
results_summary: The study found that medical hypnotherapy is effective for children with conditions like abdominal pain and headache, with potential benefits across a wide range of pediatric symptoms and diseases. It is described as an underutilized mind-body treatment with significant untapped potential.
population_specificity: Pediatric patients with various diseases and symptoms, including functional abdominal pain and headache.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the cost-effectiveness and efficacy of home-based guided hypnotherapy for children with functional abdominal pain (FAP) or irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) in primary care.
results_summary: The study design focuses on comparing care as usual (CAU) with CAU plus 3 months of home-based hypnotherapy, with primary outcomes measured at 12 months. Secondary outcomes include pain relief, daily functioning, anxiety, and healthcare use.
population_specificity: Children aged 7-17 years diagnosed with FAP or IBS by their general practitioner.
effective_dosage: Not specified (home-based guided hypnotherapy via a website for 3 months).
study_duration: 3 months of intervention, with assessments over 12 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether COMT, OPRM1, and MAO-A genetic polymorphisms are associated with hypnotherapy response in children with functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs).
results_summary: The study found no significant association between COMT, OPRM1, and MAO-A polymorphisms and treatment success or secondary outcomes (e.g., anxiety, depression, quality of life) after 3-month hypnotherapy. Hypnotherapy response was similar across genetic variations.
population_specificity: Children aged 8-18 years diagnosed with functional abdominal pain disorders (FAPDs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to understand patient experiences with virtual, group-based gut-directed hypnotherapy (GDH) to assess its acceptability and potential benefits.
results_summary: Patients generally reported positive outcomes for GI symptoms and other physical/mental health conditions, with broad support for the virtual, group format despite minor concerns about scheduling and anonymity.
population_specificity: Patients from New York University and Dartmouth Health who started GDH (≥5 visits) or did not complete it (≤3 visits).
study_duration: ≥5 visits for completers, ≤3 visits for non-completers

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the long-term effectiveness of hypnotherapy (HT) with cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) in treating mild to moderate depression, focusing on symptom maintenance, remission rates, and time to remission.
results_summary: Both HT and CBT maintained low depressive symptom levels over 12 months, with comparable long-term remission rates of 73% after a median of 30 weeks. HT showed results mostly similar to CBT in outpatient psychotherapy.
population_specificity: 152 randomized patients with current mild to moderate depression (136 available for follow-up).
study_duration: 6 months of outpatient treatment, with 12-month follow-up.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the outcomes of smartphone app-delivered gut-directed hypnotherapy (GDH) for individuals with self-reported irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) and summarize current evidence on GDH modalities.
results_summary: The study found that while adherence to smartphone-delivered GDH was low, participants who completed the therapy achieved symptom benefits. The abstract also highlights recent innovations in GDH delivery, including individualized courses, group therapy, and remote methods.
population_specificity: Individuals with self-reported IBS.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether mindful hypnotherapy effectively reduces depression, improves self-compassion, and decreases psychological inflexibility in females with major depressive disorder.
results_summary: Mindful hypnotherapy showed significant improvements in depression, self-compassion, and psychological inflexibility compared to the waitlist control group, with sustained effects at a 2-month follow-up. The intervention demonstrated large effect sizes and statistical significance across all measured outcomes.
population_specificity: Females diagnosed with major depressive disorder.
effective_dosage: 8 weekly 60-minute face-to-face therapy sessions plus daily mindful hypnosis audio tapes.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the feasibility and effectiveness of mindful hypnotherapy on psychological inflexibility, pain acceptance, headache disability, and headache intensity in patients with chronic migraine.
results_summary: Mindful hypnotherapy significantly reduced psychological inflexibility, headache disability, and headache intensity while significantly increasing pain acceptance in chronic migraine patients. The results were statistically significant (p < 0.001) across all measured outcomes.
population_specificity: 38 females with chronic migraine

study_goal: The researchers aimed to highlight the global public health issue of iodine deficiency and the importance of accurate iodine status assessment in epidemiological surveys.
results_summary: The study emphasizes that iodine deficiency affects 1.9 billion people globally, leading to severe pathologies like goiter and cretinism, and recommends urinary iodine as the primary indicator for assessing iodine status in surveys.
population_specificity: General population, with specific mention of school-aged children.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the relationship between nutritional deficiencies, including iodine, and autoimmune thyroid diseases (ATDs).
results_summary: The study highlights that iodine deficiency, along with other nutrient deficiencies, may impair thyroid function and contribute to ATDs. Proper diet, including adequate iodine intake, helps reduce symptoms and maintain thyroid health.
population_specificity: Patients with autoimmune thyroid diseases (ATDs) and associated nutritional deficiencies.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and safety of tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) in treating radioactive iodine (RAI)-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.
results_summary: TKIs showed progression-free survival of approximately 1 year and partial response rates up to 50%, with pazopanib and lenvatinib being the most active agents. Common adverse effects involved dermatologic, gastrointestinal, and cardiovascular systems.
population_specificity: Patients with RAI-refractory differentiated thyroid cancer.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the incidence and outcomes of endophthalmitis after intravitreal injections using povidone iodine (5%) as part of preinjection preparation and evaluate the effect of prophylactic topical antimicrobials.
results_summary: The study found low endophthalmitis rates (0.06% per injection) with povidone iodine use, and no significant reduction in risk with additional topical antibiotics. Visual outcomes varied, with 36% of affected eyes retaining 20/40 or better acuity.
population_specificity: Patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration enrolled in the CATT trial.
effective_dosage: 5% povidone iodine used preinjection (frequency not specified).
study_duration: Patients were followed monthly for 2 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the clinical effectiveness and safety of postoperative simultaneous integrated boost intensity modulated radiotherapy (SIB-IMRT) in patients with locoregionally advanced papillary thyroid cancer (PTC).
results_summary: The study found that postoperative SIB-IMRT significantly improved locoregional relapse-free survival (LRFS) compared to no postoperative RT (4-year LRFS: 100% vs. 84.6%, P = .002). SIB-IMRT was well tolerated with no grade ≥3 toxicity.
population_specificity: Locoregionally advanced PTC patients (pT4 or N1b) who underwent thyroid cancer surgery and radioactive iodine ablation (RIA).
